page.title: 02Features of Hamble
page.content: Hamble's most important feature is its river.The{River Hamble}is six miles long up to Botley.It has a busy port at its mouth with a harbour master and an assistant ready to give advice. On the river there is an{inshore} {rescue}which can be launched any time of day or night in seven minutes.The {Hamble to Warsash ferry}was started in 1493.The present day ferryman is Ray Sedgewick and he has been doing it every day of the year for 27 years.In the olden days the passengers had to row themselves.There is a Norman church,built in 1109,called{Saint} {Andrews church}and many old cottages from the 17th and 18th century.One of these is the{Gun House},used by smugglers in the C18th.There are many boatyards and marinas alongside the river.There are also four pubs and a variety of shops.
